Sentencas: Distribution of relaxation times (DRT) is a well-established method for deconvoluting electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) data from fuel cells.
Titulo: How the distribution of relaxation times enhances complex equivalent circuit models for fuel cells

Sentencas: DRT-analysis provides a deeper insight into electrode reactions and supports identification of the most accurate equivalent circuit models.
Titulo: How the distribution of relaxation times enhances complex equivalent circuit models for fuel cells

Sentencas: This established method has undergone much change in recent decades and has been applied to many sub-fields.
Titulo: How the distribution of relaxation times enhances complex equivalent circuit models for fuel cells

Sentencas: Contemporary studies are highly specialized and produce specialist literature: to further a comprehensive view, this paper provides an overview and retrospective.
Titulo: How the distribution of relaxation times enhances complex equivalent circuit models for fuel cells

Sentencas: EIS measurement and subsequent interpretation by DRT are challenging because (i) high-performance electrodes have very low impedances (10-100 m Omega ), (ii) the concept of one rate-limiting step is usually not applicable, and (iii) the charge transfer and transport processes in anode and cathode are often coupled; overlapping in the frequency domain.
Titulo: How the distribution of relaxation times enhances complex equivalent circuit models for fuel cells

Sentencas: In this paper selected results from advanced EIS and DRT analyses are discussed.
Titulo: How the distribution of relaxation times enhances complex equivalent circuit models for fuel cells

Sentencas: We demonstrate the importance of EIS data quality, introduce the use of the Kramers-Kronig transformation, explain the impacts of statistically distributed noise and single errors in EIS spectra, and the selection of the regularization parameter lambda for improved interpretation of DRT curves.
Titulo: How the distribution of relaxation times enhances complex equivalent circuit models for fuel cells

Sentencas: Finally, well-selected examples of DRT approaches lead to adequate models with different complexity.
Titulo: How the distribution of relaxation times enhances complex equivalent circuit models for fuel cells

Sentencas: As a result, this paper deepens the understanding of how to assess electrochemical measurements of fuel cells based on the DRT.
Titulo: How the distribution of relaxation times enhances complex equivalent circuit models for fuel cells

Sentencas: It, therefore, represents a vital guide for DRT analysis.
